data.title: 20 Most Popular Songs About Werewolves of All Time, Ranked, Youtube Lyrics
data.meta_description: Here is a list of the Most Popular Songs About Werewolves of All Time. It has something for every werewolf fan to sink their teeth into.
data.meta_site_name: Greatest Songs - Sing Better - Musical Instruments
data.text:
Werewolves have long been a subject of fascination and fear in various cultures worldwide.

These mythical creatures, human by day and wolf by the full moon’s light, have inspired countless stories, books, and songs.

In the music world, there is a plethora of popular songs that explore this creature’s mysterious and dark nature.

Here is a list of the Most Popular Songs About Werewolves of All Time. It has something for every werewolf fan to sink their teeth into.

1. “Howlin’ for You” by The Black Keys

“Howlin’ for You” by The Black Keys is a catchy and energetic song about a werewolf searching for love. With its blues rock sound and powerful vocals, it captures the essence of being wild and free like a wolf.

The lyrics take us through the life of this creature, howling in the night as it longs for a connection with someone who understands its primal nature.

2. “Wolf Moon” by Type O Negative

“Wolf Moon” by Type O Negative is a haunting and mesmerizing song that perfectly captures the allure and mystique of werewolves.

The track featured on the band’s 1996 album October Rust tells the story of a person who transforms into a werewolf under the full moon’s light.

With its dark and brooding lyrics and hypnotic melody, “Wolf Moon” transports listeners into a world of primal instincts and animalistic desires.

Frontman Peter Steele’s deep and powerful vocals add to the song’s eerie atmosphere, while intricate guitar riffs and driving drums create a sense of urgency and danger.

3. “Hungry Like the Wolf” by Duran Duran

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SSPexYpGF3U

“Hungry Like the Wolf” by Duran Duran is one of their most iconic songs, known for its catchy beat and memorable lyrics.

The lyrics vividly depict a wild and untamed creature driven by hunger and desire on the hunt for its prey.

It captures a human’s primal instinct and transformation into a wolf under the full moon’s light.

4. “Of Wolf And Man” by Metallica

“Of Wolf And Man” by Metallica is a powerful heavy metal song that tells the story of werewolves.

The song starts with a captivating guitar riff accompanied by James Hetfield’s intense vocals, instantly drawing listeners into its dark and mysterious world.

The lyrics describe the transformation of a man into a wolf and his struggle to control his savage side.

5. “Werewolf” by Fiona Apple

“Werewolf” by Fiona Apple is a haunting yet mesmerizing song that explores the concept of being a werewolf and all the complexities that come with it.

Apple’s raw and emotional vocals perfectly capture the feelings of struggling with one’s true identity as she sings about trying to hide her inner beast from the world.

The lyrics are filled with vivid imagery, depicting someone constantly battling their nature and feeling like an outcast in society.

6. “Brother Wolf, Sister Moon” by The Cult

“Brother Wolf, Sister Moon” is a timeless classic by the British rock band The Cult that tells the tale of werewolves in a captivating and haunting manner.

It radiates an aura of mystery and symbolism, perfectly encapsulating the theme of transformation and duality often associated with these mythical creatures.

7. “The Werewolf” by Paul Simon

“The Werewolf” by Paul Simon is a haunting and thought-provoking song that delves into the idea of physical and mental transformation.

The song’s eerie melody sets the tone for a tale of a man who becomes a werewolf every night, but unlike traditional stories, he embraces it to break free from his mundane life.

8. “Bark At The Moon” by Ozzy Osbourne

“Bark At The Moon” by Ozzy Osbourne is a classic rock song that has become an anthem for werewolf lovers.

Released in 1983, this song captures the essence of a werewolf’s transformation and their wild, uncontrollable nature.

The lyrics are dark and haunting, depicting the struggle between man and beast as the full moon rises.

9. “Werewolf, Baby!” by Rob Zombie

“Werewolf, Baby!” by Rob Zombie is a thrilling song that pays homage to the classic horror figure of werewolves.

The lyrics paint a vivid picture of how these creatures transform under the full moon, as zombie’s growling vocals perfectly capture their primal nature.

The heavy, gritty guitar riffs and pounding drums add to the intense atmosphere of the song, making you feel like a pack of werewolves is chasing you.

10. “Witch Wolf” by Styx

“Witch Wolf” is a captivating song by the iconic American rock band Styx that tells the tale of werewolves.

From their 1984 album “Caught in the Act,” this song takes us on a mystical journey into the world of supernatural beings and their struggle to contain their wild instincts.

11. “Werewolves Of London” by Warren Zevon

“Werewolves Of London” by Warren Zevon is a classic song about the mythical creatures that haunt our imaginations, such as werewolves.

With its infectious and upbeat melody, this song has become an iconic representation of all things spooky and Halloween.

Released in 1978, it tells the tale of a mysterious and dangerous man who roams the streets of London under the full moon.

12. “Dog Bite” by Dead Kennedys

“Dog Bite” is a thrilling and intense song by the American punk band Dead Kennedys.

The song talks about the frightening concept of werewolves and their uncontrollable urge to attack and inflict harm on others.

With powerful guitar riffs and gritty vocals, the band vividly depicts these monstrous creatures that roam the night.

13. “A Wolf at the Door” by Radiohead

“A Wolf at the Door” by Radiohead is an enthralling and eerie song that delves into the world of werewolves.

The haunting lyrics and ominous melody create a sense of unease, setting the perfect atmosphere for a tale about these mythical creatures.

The song paints a vivid picture of a person struggling to contain their inner wolf, constantly on edge and afraid that they will lose control.

14. “Wolf” by Iced Earth

“Wolf” by Iced Earth is a thrilling heavy metal song that will take you on an intense journey through the world of werewolves.

From the start, the powerful guitar riffs and pounding drums set the tone for an epic tale about these shape-shifting creatures.

The lyrics vividly depict their primal instincts and desire to hunt under the full moon’s light.

15. “Wolves” by Langhorne Slim

“Wolves” by Langhorne Slim is a quirky and upbeat song that brings a playful twist to the traditionally eerie theme of werewolves.

With rollicking guitar riffs and lively vocals, Slim tells the story of a man who turns into a wolf under the full moon.

However, unlike most songs about werewolves, this one doesn’t evoke fear or terror. Instead, it captures the excitement and thrill of embracing one’s wild side.

16. “She Wolf” by Shakira

“She Wolf” by Shakira is a catchy and upbeat song that explores the idea of werewolves in a unique way.

While most songs about werewolves focus on these creatures’ fearsome and dangerous nature, This song takes a different approach by showcasing the transformation into a werewolf as something empowering and liberating.

With its irresistible dance beats and Shakira’s signature vocals, “She Wolf” celebrates embracing one’s wild side and breaking free from societal norms and expectations.

17. “Raised by Wolves” by U2

“Raised by Wolves” is a mesmerizing rock song by the iconic Irish band U2.

With its pulsating beats and haunting lyrics, the song tells the story of a young boy raised by werewolves in a world filled with violence and destruction.

The lyrics paint a vivid picture of a post-apocalyptic world where children are left to fend for themselves and survive in a harsh environment ruled by predators.

18. “The Wolves” by Bon Iver

“The Wolves” by Bon Iver is a hauntingly beautiful song that tells the tale of werewolves.

With its sad melody and poetic lyrics, the song captures the essence of these mythical creatures in a captivating and eerie way.

The track begins with soft acoustic guitar strums and Justin Vernon’s delicate vocals, creating a sense of vulnerability before launching into a crescendo of haunting harmonies.

The lyrics are about a vivid picture of these shape-shifting beasts roaming the dark forest under the full moon’s light.

19. “Running with the Pack” by Bad Company

“Running with the Pack” by Bad Company is a thrilling and energetic song about werewolves.

The band’s signature blues-rock sound perfectly captures these mystical creatures’ primal and wild nature.

The lyrics vividly depict a pack of werewolves running through the night, howling at the moon and letting their true selves take over.

20. “Wolf Among Wolves” by Bonnie Prince Billy

“Wolf Among Wolves” by Bonnie Prince Billy is a captivating song about a werewolf struggling with their inner beast.

With hauntingly beautiful lyrics and a mesmerizing melody, this song paints a vivid picture of the internal battle between humanity and instincts.

Bonnie Prince Billy’s raw vocals add depth to the lyrics, conveying the pain and turmoil of being caught between worlds.

FAQs

What are werewolves famous for?

Werewolves, also known as lycanthropes, have captured the imagination of people for centuries.

They are famous for their ability to transform from a human form into a wolf or a hybrid creature under the full moon.

This shapeshifting power is often seen as a curse, passed down through generations, or acquired through being bitten by another werewolf. These creatures are often associated with a sense of danger and mystery.

In popular culture, werewolves are depicted as ferocious and powerful beings with heightened senses and physical abilities.

However, they are also known for their vulnerability to silver and garlic, which can be used to defeat them.

Despite being feared in many stories and legends, werewolves have gained a dedicated fan base who admire their loyalty and pack mentality.

What are some fun facts about werewolves?

Werewolves, also known as lycanthropes, are mythical creatures that have fascinated people for centuries.

These half-human, half-wolf beings have been the center of many legends and folklore worldwide.

But did you know that there are some fun facts about werewolves that you may not be aware of?

For instance, contrary to popular belief, werewolves can shift into their wolf form at any time, not just during a full moon.

And speaking of the full moon, while it is often associated with werewolves in pop culture, no concrete evidence supports this connection.

Moreover, werewolves are said to have super strength and heightened senses in both human and wolf form. However, they also possess a weakness for silver objects and can be killed by a silver weapon or bullet.

Another interesting fact is that a real-life clinical condition called “clinical lycanthropy” exists where individuals believe they can turn into a werewolf.

What is a werewolf’s weakness?

A werewolf is a mythical creature that has captured the imagination of many with its ferocious appearance and ability to transform from human to wolf form.

However, like any other creature, werewolves also have weaknesses. The most well-known weakness is silver. It is said that silver bullets or weapons can cause serious harm or even kill a werewolf.

Apart from this, it is believed that an object of pure silver, such as a necklace or ring, can weaken a werewolf’s powers and make them vulnerable.

Additionally, the legend says certain herbs and plants, such as wolfsbane and mistletoe, can repel and weaken a werewolf.

Furthermore, some say that the sound of church bells or holy water can also adversely affect these creatures.

While these may be fictional beliefs, they add an intriguing layer to the already fascinating world of werewolves.

Is werewolf good or bad?

The question remains: is the werewolf good or bad? Well, it depends on how one perceives it.

On the one hand, the idea of transforming into a ferocious beast under the full moon and causing harm to others can be seen as negative and dangerous.

However, some argue that this transformation is not within the person’s control and, therefore, cannot be judged as good or bad.

Many cultures have depicted werewolves as protectors or guardians rather than villains. They possess heightened senses and strength that can be used to defend their territory and loved ones.

Whether werewolves are good or bad is subjective and can vary based on personal beliefs and interpretations.

So perhaps, instead of labeling them as purely good or bad, we should embrace the complexity of these creatures and appreciate them for all their mysterious qualities.

Why are werewolves so angry?

Werewolves are mythical creatures that are believed to have the ability to transform from human to wolf-like beings.

They have gained a reputation for being incredibly fierce and angry, but have you ever wondered why?

There are a few reasons that could explain their intense anger.

Firstly, the transformation process itself is said to be extremely painful and can cause significant physical and emotional distress. This could lead to feelings of frustration and rage in werewolves.

Additionally, the full moon’s association with their transformation may make them feel trapped and controlled by this natural phenomenon, causing them to lash out in anger.

Moreover, werewolves often face discrimination and fear from society due to their monstrous appearance, leading them to constantly feel misunderstood and rejected – another possible trigger for anger.

Lastly, legends depict werewolves as solitary creatures forced to live in secrecy due to the fear of being exposed and hunted down by humans. This isolation may also contribute to their pent-up anger towards society, which has shunned them.

So, while they may appear ferocious on the surface, perhaps we should try to understand why werewolves are so angry instead of fearing them.

Are all werewolves evil?

There has been a long-standing misconception in popular culture that all werewolves are evil creatures. However, this is simply not true.

Just like humans, werewolves are individuals with unique personalities and traits. While some may have a darker side, others can be kind and compassionate.

It is unfair to label an entire species as inherently evil based on the actions of a few.

Like any other creature, werewolves can make choices and decisions, and these choices define their morality, not their species.

Conclusion

We hope this list of popular songs about werewolves has sparked your interest and even introduced you to some new tunes.

Whether you’re a fan of the supernatural or just love a good beat, these songs will surely get you howling along.
